intro: Parnassia asarifolia, commonly known as the white crowfoot, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant has palmate leaves that are usually divided into five lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Parnassia asarifolia is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
